comments.author: teosanru
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on March 19, 2023, 05:08:50 PMyou all know about market cap and total money invest in crypto market,marketcap is determined by total value of all coins combined in current time is called marketman*marketcaptotal money invested in market is determined by I don't know, if you know please tell me.I was searched on google just for fun what is total money invested in crypto but it was highlighting just market cap for that search result,as here shown: https://ibb.co/7RNfFXgis it possible to determine the total money invested in crypto market,or i am wrong with this thread.The amount of total money invested in the market is nothing but the market cap. Only difference is it's not the amount invest at its cost but it's current value. Imagine a small market. If you see it in a way that a person A has 2 Bitcoins which he purchased at $2000 each from C and a person B has 3 Bitcoin which he purchased at $3000 each from C. Now the Last traded price is $3000 therefore market cap is 5 bitcoins x 3k = 15k, now if A buys 1 more bitcoin from B at $4000, the new market cap is now 5 x 4k = 20k. Now technically new money in the market is 4k but the value increase of market is 5k. So market cap is not the money invested at it's cost but at it's current value.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: Every website retrieves data from different sources, making it difficult to determine the precise cryptocurrency market capitalization in real-time. For instance, CoinMarketCap (CMC) and CoinGecko (CG) will show their respective data, which will not be identical. Additionally, the total cryptocurrency market capitalization does not necessarily equate to the total amount of money invested. In fact, only Bitcoin's market capitalization would be considered accurate due to the absence of pre-mining, and its circulation is real. Therefore, there is no genuine data available for total market capitalization that can be deemed 100% accurate. Google only displays sources of the data.

comments.author: Dr.Osh
comments.body: it is very difficult to determine the exact amount of the total funds that have been invested in crypto to date because every day there are people who invest and there are people who withdraw their investments. So, the value will continue to decrease and increase depending on people's needs. Google only shows data when the data is uploaded, and the data provided is only an estimate. In fact, if you go deeper into the data, I'm pretty sure that you won't get the exact data because it will keep changing. you will only get data about a range of values close to the total amount of investments that were in crypto at that time.
